line_1: The silly Tenant of the Summer-Air.
line_2: Comes fluttering forth a gaudy spendthrift Heir,

line_1: The silly Tenant of the Summer-Air.
line_2: In Folly lost, of Nothing takes he Care;

line_1: The silly Tenant of the Summer-Air.
line_2: And thieving Tradesmen him among them share:

line_1: Like painted insects, through the summer-air
line_2: And tasting every flower and blossom fair,

line_1: Like painted insects, through the summer-air
line_2: Withouten any choice, withouten any care.
